Text: It scares us just thinking about it.
When you hear it, you're gonna think we 're insane.
Try us. Please, from the start.
It started out small, like a hand or a leg was in a different position.
Then its head was looking up instead of down.
And then one day, it was in a completely different room.
It was moving around by itself.
Ever think maybe somebody had a key to your apartment and was playing a trick?
But never once did we find any sign or evidence of intrusion.
And this all led you to believe that the doll was possessed?
Camilla got in touch with a medium. We learned from her that a 7yearold girl...
...named Annabelle Higgins had died in this apartment.
She was lonely and took a liking to my doll.
All she wanted was to be friends.
When we heard this, we felt really sorry for her.
I mean, we're nurses, we help people.
...we gave her permission to move into the doll.
She wanted to live with us by inhabiting the doll.
When we came home, she was sitting in the hallway.
But we had left her in the spare room.
We don't know what's going on or what to do. Can you help us?
Now, firstly, there's no such thing as Annabelle, and there never was.
I think what we have here is something extremely manipulative.
It was a big mistake acknowledging this doll.
And through that, the inhuman spirit tricked you.
You gave it permission to infest your lives.
It's something that's never walked the earth in human form.
So the doll was never possessed?
No, no, it was used as a conduit.
It was moved around to give the impression of possession.
Demonic spirits don't possess things, they possess people.
It wanted to get inside of you.
All right, that's good, Drew. You can shut it down now.
So we got the church to send a priest over...
...to bless the house and the occupants.
Whatever was oppressing that apartment was no longer with them. Any questions?
Yep.  So, what are you guys?
I mean, what do people call you?
Uh, well, we've been called Demonologists. That's one name for us.
But we prefer to be known simply as Ed and Lorraine Warren.
Okay. Guys, we are here!  Get out of the car.
Oh, God, we're in the middle of nowhere.
Are you so excited? Where's my "yes"? Where's my "yes"? Yes!
I'm so excited!  Come on, Sadie!
Are you kidding me? No dibs on the rooms!
So do I get to pick my own room? Or do I have no choice in that either?
Well, first cute boy she meets, she'll forget about Jersey.
What's your name?  What's your name?
Who's your daddy?  Who's your daddy?
He rich?  Is he rich like me?
Where do you want it?  In the living room.
Andrea, where's my wind chime?  I think Nancy's got it in the other room.
Thanks. Hey, Nancy, have you seen my wind chime?
You're gonna have to catch it.  Nancy! Let go! Give it here.
Hey, Mom, can I hang up my wind chime?
Of course. There's a line outside you can hang it on.
Honey, have April come in, okay? It's gonna be dark soon.
Come on, April! Mom wants us inside!
Come on, come on, come on. No peeking.
Are you guys done with the pizza? I don't want it going to waste.
Let's go.  It's expensive feeding you girls.
Ready or not, here I come!
Whoa!  You don't know the house well enough.
All right, what did we break now?
I didn't mean to.  Move out of there, please.
Oh, jeez.  My fault? Oh, my God.
Christine did it.  No, I didn't.
You pushed me.  No, no, you fell back.
Hey, Nancy, can you go get me the matches, please?
Whoa.  I think we have a cellar or something.
I wanna see, I wanna see. Move, move, move.
I wanna see.  You can see.
I wanna see.  You can all see.
What do you see down there?
Just, uh, hard to tell, you know?
It's an old piano and a whole bunch of garbage.
I don't want you girls going down there.
That place is loaded with spiders.  Ew!
Stop it, Nancy. It's not funny.
We've got extra square footage anyway. I'll check it out in the morning.
I wonder why it was boarded up.  I don't know.
Up to bed. Please. Thank you.  Right to bed.
Yeah, I don't know what her problem is. Couldn't get her to come inside.
We can't leave her out there.
She's all right. I got her on a chain.
I know it was a lot to bite off.
It's gonna be great, isn't it?
You still too fried to christen the new house?
Ain't nobody here's fried.  Ha, ha.
Hey. How did you guys sleep?
You think maybe we could have bought a house with a toilet that actually works?
And there was a funky smell in my room last night. Like something died.
This is gonna take some serious elbow grease.
What are we gonna do with all this stuff?
Well, we probably ought to go through it, you know?
There might be some antiques down here worth a lot.
Yeah, or just a lot of junk the previous owner didn't want.
It's ours now.  Knock yourself out.
I'm gonna make some coffee.  Okay.
I'm gonna see if I can get this furnace working.
Yeah, that'd be nice. It's freezing.
She's outside. You know, I'm sure she's hungry by now. Why don't you go and get her.
This clock stopped at 3:07, and so did the one in the hallway.
Maybe it got knocked around in the move.
Speaking of knocked around, what did you do to me last night?
Ouch. I didn't do that. Did I?  I don't know.
We keep everything locked in here.
So all these are taken from cases you've investigated?
That's right. Everything you see in here is either haunted, cursed...
...or has been used in some kind of ritualistic practice.
Oh, ahem. Well, isn't it scary, or doesn't it worry you...
...to have all these items right in your home?
That's why we have a priest that comes by once a month to bless the room.
Well, the way I see it is:
It's safer for these things to be in here than out there.
It's kind of like keeping guns off the street.
Why not just throw them in an incinerator? Destroy them.
Well, that would only destroy the vessel.
Sometimes it's better to keep the genie in the bottle.
Say, is the, uh, Annabelle doll here?
You said she's a conduit?  That's right.
A very powerful demonic has latched itself onto her.
So when you guys investigate these hauntings...
...how do you stop them from latching onto you?
We have to take great precaution.
Well, Father Gordon told me that...
What happened to my wife happened during an exorcism.
Come on. Did you touch anything?  No.
Georgiana! Could you take Judy upstairs?  Oh, sure.
You can't go into this room, no matter what, remember?
Let's see if I can find you a little snack, okay? Come on.
Hey. What's going on in here?
Daddy, look.  You look very pretty.
All right, all done. Go get dressed for dinner.
I'm wearing it to dinner.  No, you're not!
Oh, I think he may write a positive article.
Shut up, I didn't do anything.
Don't blame that on me. It's you. Pew.
Andrea, what are you doing out of bed?
It's Cindy. She's in my room. She's sleepwalking again.
I've never seen her do this before.
I remembered you saying not to wake her if she's like this.
No, we just put her back to bed.
She's sleepwalking again? She hasn't done that for a while.
She ended up in Andrea's room too. I think kind of freaked her out.
That's not good. What are we gonna do?  I don't know.
Honey, you got another bruise here.  Hmm?
I don't know. Will you do me a favor, go see a doctor for that?
Yeah, I will. Drive safe.  Yeah.
I love you.  I love you too.
Cindy, you have your lunch?  Yeah.
Who are you talking to?  Rory.
He's my new friend.  Oh, really?
Yeah, do you want to see him?  Yeah. Uhhuh. How?
When the music stops, you see him in the mirror standing behind you.
But you have to twist the key.
April, you just gave me a heart attack.  Got you!
Well, okay, I guess Rory doesn't want to see me, huh?
Hideandcla...? Oh, honey, I don't want to play.
Please! Nobody ever lets me play.  Okay, okay.
Remember, you get to ask me for three claps.
I'm gonna go hide now!  Okay.
Oh, I know where you're hiding.
Ha, ha. You took your blindfold off. I win!
You weren't even warm, Mom. I was in Christine and Nancy's room.
I gotta have some routes here, or I'm gonna lose the insurance on the rig.
That's like half of my rate, man.
I'll, uh... Yeah, I'll take it.
What's the route?  It's, uh, Florida.
It's a week turnaround. I start tomorrow.
Come on, let's go to bed.
Stop it, Nancy. It's not funny anymore.
I'm trying to sleep, please stop grabbing my feet.
Look, there's no one here. See?
What's going on? What happened?  There was someone else in here!
By the door. It was behind the door.
Honey, there's nothing in here. There's nobody in here.
There was someone else in here!
I was just sleeping, and then I felt somebody grab my feet.
So I thought it was Nancy.
Well, honey, I'm pretty sure that it was just a bad dream.
I just gotta run to the store for a few things.
Why do you even try?  What? What do you mean?
In 15 years have you ever been able to lie to me?
Father Gordon called. He's got a case he wants us to look into.
I said I'd go check it out myself. Lorraine, myself.
I know you're worried it's gonna happen again.
Yeah, I am. I really am.
Maybe it's just time we take a break. Write that book.
Do you remember what you said to me on our wedding night?
You said that God brought us together for a reason. Right?
I'm pretty sure it's not to write a book.
We've isolated the disturbances to the attic.
I want you to listen for a second.
Right now it's just my weight. But you take the water coming off the pipe...
...combined with the wind coming through the broken window...
...these boards are gonna expand and rub against each other.
You heard it all through the house because of these pipes leading to the radiator.
Yeah, there's usually always some kind of rational explanation.
Girls, it's way past your bedtime.
Who's ever down there, I'm gonna lock you in now!
Okay, you can just sleep with me tonight, all right?
Somebody, goddamn it, tell me what's going on here?
Fear is defined as a feeling of agitation and anxiety caused by the presence...
Whether it's a ghost, a spirit or an entity, they all feed on it.
A FrenchCanadian farmer with no more than a thirdgrade education...
...yet after he was possessed, spoke some of the best Latin I'd ever heard.
He'd been molested by his father, who had also tortured him repeatedly.
A dark spirit made its home in this man.
Now, if you look into his eyes, you can see him tearing blood.
...an upsidedown cross started to appear from within his body.
All right, Drew, you can hit the lights.
Did you personally perform the exorcism?
No, I'm not authorized. But I've assisted on many.
See, an exorcism can be very dangerous...
...not only for the victim, but for anyone in the room.
What happened to Maurice?  He tried to kill his wife...
...but instead shot her in the arm and then turned the gun on himself.
Maurice had a very troubled life with little to live for...
...and not even an exorcist could bring him back.
Which brings us to the three stages of demonic activity:
That's the whispering, the footsteps, the feeling of another presence...
...which ultimately grows into oppression, the second stage.
Now this is where the victim, and it's usually the one...
...is targeted specifically by an external force.
Breaks the victim down. Crushes their will.
And, once in a weakened state, leads them to the third and final stage: possession.
There's someone here that would like to talk to you.
Thank you.  I'll see you later.
There's something horrible happening in my house. Could you come and take a look?
You know, uh, it's getting kinda late.
We really need to head to our family.  You don't understand.
But we do. There's usually some sort of rational explanation...
I have five daughters who are scared to death. I'm so afraid this thing wants to hurt us.
You have a daughter. Wouldn't you do anything you could to protect her? Please.
Please can you come and take a look?
The top of your head turned black.
Don't be silly, it's a wig.
Hey, nice to meet you, Roger. Ed Warren.
Thanks for coming.  Please, come in.
Oh, my God. Look at you all. Who are these beautiful young women?
This is Andrea, the oldest, Nancy, Cindy, Christine...
We're all sleeping down here now.  Mm.
The girls feel safer and it's warmer.
I'm constantly turning up the heat, but the house is always freezing.
It's not a problem with the furnace.
I mean, not that I can find.
It's gotten a lot worse the past few nights.
There's this awful smell, like rotting meat. It moves around the house.
Well, rancid smells could indicate some type of demonic activity.
That's to keep those doors from banging at night.
Otherwise, it's like: All night long, just like that.
Does it come in threes?  Yeah.
Well, sometimes it's meant as an insult to the Trinity:
The Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit.
You know, it's the damndest thing, but we also get all kinds of birds...
...that will just fly against the side of the house and break their necks.
And the clocks stop at 3:07 a.m.
Oh, we were hanging those along the stairs.
Something just kept knocking them down, so we stopped hanging them up.
That's what I was talking about.
It was here when we moved in.
There's also a lot of stuff in the cellar.
Look what she made me do.
You picking up anything in here, hon?
Those bruises, they from something that happened here?
Oh, it's some iron deficiency thing I have.
You know, with all that's been going on, why haven't you just moved out?
I don't know where we'd move to, you know?
We got all our money tied up in this place and had a lot of repairs on top of that.
And I don't know anybody whose gonna take in a family of seven indefinitely.
That's why we tracked you down.
My name is Ed Warren. It's November 1st, 1971.
I'm sitting here with Carolyn Perron...
...who, with her family, has been experiencing supernatural occurrences.
I guess it was the clocks.
Mom and Dad tell me that you have a friend.
His name's Rory. He lives here too.
He won't tell me but I think something bad happened to him.
Do you mind if I try to see Rory?
We bought it at auction from the bank, so, you know, we never knew who lived here.
Well, Lorraine and I both feel that what your house needs is a cleansing.
I thought that was something that you do to people.
We have to get out of here.
I'm afraid that's not gonna help.
I've been seeing the dark entity that haunts your house...
I saw it first when I came through your door.
It was latched to your back.
And then I saw it again with the girls when we walked into the living room.
And it doesn't matter where you go...
...this dark entity has latched itself to your family...
Sometimes when you get haunted, it's like stepping on gum.
Look, I gotta tell you, you have a lot of spirits in here...
...but this is the one that I'm most worried about, because it is so hateful.
Okay, so what do we do? Can we call a priest?
I wish it were that easy.
Performing an exorcism is an archaic procedure. Requires years of training.
And even then, I have seen it go horribly wrong.
But before we even get that far, the church has to authorize it first.
It means we gotta investigate, gather evidence and provide proof...
Uh, no, we never got around to that. We're not really a churchgoing family.
Well, you may want to rethink that. Our presence here could make things worse.
And whatever you're dealing with here isn't gonna like us.
So far it hasn't done anything violent, and that's a good sign.
So we're gonna have our guy do some homework on the property...
Judy, what are you up to?
I got you a present.  Aah.
Me and Nanna got these at the church's yard sale.
Honey.  One for you and one for me.
Nanna said this way we'll always be together.
You'll be with me and I'll be with you.
You're not gonna believe this. Carolyn's voice didn't record.
My name is Ed Warren. It's November 1st, 1971.
I'm sitting here with Carolyn Perron...
...who, with her family, has been experiencing supernatural occurrences.
I don't know. You find anything?  Lots.
I mean, it's no wonder they're going through what they are.
It was built in 1863 by a man named Jedson Sherman...
...who was married to a woman named Bathsheba.
Ed, she's related to Mary Towne Estye.
She was one of the women accused of witchcraft in Salem.
She was hung during the trials.  Wow.
After Bathsheba married Jedson, they had a baby...
...and when the baby was 7 days old...
...Jedson caught her sacrificing it in front of the fireplace.
She ran out to that tree by the dock...
...climbed up, proclaimed her love to Satan...
...cursed anyone who tried to take her land, and hung herself.
Time of death was pronounced at 3:07 in the morning.
Well, that explains a few things.
Her last name's Walker. She lived there in the '30s.
She had a boy named Rory who mysteriously disappeared in the woods.
Then she killed herself in the cellar.
So, what was the original 200acre farm has since been subdivided and sold off.
There was another boy who drowned in a pond here. He lived in a house over here.
And a woman who worked as a maid in a neighboring home, she committed suicide too.
I'm sitting here with Carolyn Perron...
...who, with her family, has been experiencing supernatural occurrences.
You find it okay?  Oh, yeah.
Officer Brad Hamilton, Harrisville, Rhode Island P.D.
Hm. Nice to meet you, man.
So you're the lucky new cop, huh?  Guess so.
You know you can't shoot ghosts, right?  Take it easy on him, Drew.
All right, guys, help me get this stuff unloaded.
All right. When you're finished here, why don't you hit upstairs, all right, Drew?
Ugh, what's not wrong with her?
Needs a new carburetor to start.  Oh, yeah?
Kind of put fixing her up on hold for a while.
Hey, Brad, hand me a thermostat, would you?
When there's an instant drop in temperature...
...the thermostat triggers the camera to take a picture.
You've actually caught things on film?
Well, yeah, that's, uh, the point.
Well, this is where the witch committed suicide.
She hung herself from that branch right above where you're standing.
How could a mother kill her own child?
It was never a child to her.
She just used her Godgiven gift as the ultimate offense against him.
Witches believe it elevates their status in the eyes of Satan.
Wow. That's a nice day at the beach, huh?
It's an insight. It's like a peek through the curtain into another person's life.
That day meant so much to me. We were driving along the coast.
Nancy pointed out how pretty the view was.
I thought this is a perfect opportunity for a photo.
We're gonna start fresh, you know? A new house, a new beginning.
You should have seen Roger and the girls. I've never seen them so happy.
They mean the world to me.
Put your hand flat on the desk.
It just reveals to us what the naked eye can't see.
Drew, you got the Bolex ready for Brad?
Yeah, already locked and loaded, sir.
All the rooms are coming in pretty good.
...will get a reaction from anything unholy.
So I set these throughout the house, see if I can stir things up a bit.
Like holding a cross to a vampire?  Yeah. Exactly.
Except I don't believe in vampires.
All right, it's 9:18, we're headed down into the cellar where the door's just opened on its own.
I have Lorraine and Officer Brad Hamilton with me.
Let's keep the cellar light off.
Give us a sign that you wanna communicate with us.
All right, close the door. Move something.  My hands are so cold.
Well, like I said, it doesn't always work when you want it to.
Yeah, maybe the camera picked something up.
For a guy who doesn't believe...
...you looked a little freaked out when that door slammed shut.
It must have been a draft.
A draft never put that look on my face before.
I think I might take some girls for ice cream later on. What do you say about that?
I'm exhausted. I'm just gonna take a nap. The late nights are getting to me.
That's probably a good idea. Why don't you get some rest.
Lorraine and I'll watch over things for a bit.  Really?
I'm gonna take off. I have a shift starting in an hour.
The house hasn't felt like this in a long time.
I think the kids feel a lot safer with you around.
I could get used to this.  What, me doing laundry?
They have such a beautiful family, don't they?
Yeah, that little one, April, did you see her bring me pancakes?
I'll start with the Chevy.  Heh.
Oh, I'm fine.  Are you sick?
I woke up feeling nauseous, that's all.  I thought I saw...
I hear Roger and the girls.
Guys, do you wanna play a game?  Boring!
Hey, I hope you don't mind.
I got a good deal on a rebuild at that wrecking yard in Smithfield.
No, you look like you know what you're doing.  Yeah, we'll see.
Got a nice place here, Roger.
Lorraine and I always wanted a spot in the country.
Hey, hand me a wrench, would you?
Hey, uh, it really means a lot to us to have you here.
I gotta admit, I was a little bit skeptical going in.
Just wanna say thank you, though, for coming out when you did.
I can't take the credit. That's, uh... That's all Lorraine.
I didn't want to.  Oh. Why's that?
Whatever Lorraine sees, feels, touches, it helps people.
But it also takes a toll on her.
Couple months ago we were working on a case.
It took a real big piece.
...she went into our room, locked herself in...
...didn't talk, didn't eat, didn't come out for eight days.
I need to reload. You want some?
Look what she made me do.
Look what she made me do.
Look what she made me do!
Hold up, Brad. What's going on?
I saw someone. There was a woman dressed as a maid.
It's just Cindy. She's sleepwalking.  No, wait. We need this.
Why do we need pictures of Cindy?
What do you mean she didn't trigger it?  Somebody's with her.
There's someone else in there with her.
I'm hearing another voice. Here, listen.
Drew, I need a UV light.  Uh...
Here, that's it. Go, go, go, go!
All right. You got her?  Yeah.
That's where Rory hides when he's afraid.
Hon? Could I have April's music box, please?
How's Cindy?  She doesn't remember a thing.
Ed, I know what she did.
I got you. I know. It's okay.  I know what she did.
I know what she did. She possessed the mother to kill the child.
That's what the bruise marks are! She's feeding off of her!
I'll have the footage developed and get it over to Father Gordon.
He's our liaison at the church. I imagine we'll get a pretty fast response.
Listen, when we get the exorcist, I'll be back. But Lorraine...
Yeah, I understand.  Until then Drew's gonna keep an eye on you.
Hey, Ed, thank you for everything.  Yeah.
Mom, it's me. Is Judy okay?
What?  Can you go check, please?
Damn it, Mom, just check, please!
Are you gonna tell me what's going on?  It's Judy.
Mom, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to scare you. I'll explain later, okay?
I had a vision of Judy in the water.
I know it was some kind of warning.
So?  Yeah, well, you weren't kidding.
Look, Ed, this is complicated because the kids aren't baptized.
No, I understand.  And the family are not members of the church.
The approval would have to come directly from the Vatican.
Father, we've never seen nothing like this.
Father, they don't have a lot of time.
Thank you, Father. Thank you.  Thank you.
All right, we'll wait for your call.  Yeah.
Judy! Judy, open this door!  What is it?
What's wrong with her? Judy!  Hey, move. Move, move, move, move.
Judy, get back, honey. Get back!
Get away from the door, Judy!
There was someone rocking in the chair with Annabelle.
Dad! Dad! Mom just left with Christine and April.
She went in the car and drove away. I don't know what happened.
She smells like rotting meat.  She didn't say what was going on.
What do you mean, she left? Left where?  Gone! I don't know where she was going.
Andrea was here, said Carolyn took off with Christine and April.
The girls said she smelled like rotten meat.  Possesses the mother...
...to kill the child, that's what she does. She's taking them to the house.
Roger, get back to the house now. I'll meet you.
Lock the door, close the blinds. Stay off the phone!
I'm coming.  No, you stay with Judy.
Only way to protect Judy is if we stop this where it started.
Otherwise, she'll latch onto us again.  That's exactly why I am going.
You think I'm gonna let you walk into this alone?
Carolyn, don't! No, no! She's got...!
Get her hand! Get the scissors!
We gotta get her to the car!  And bring her where?
To take her to the priest for the exorcism.
Take Christine to the car and find April!
She won't let her leave the house.  What do you mean?
If we take her out, the witch will kill her.  Agh!
Okay, I'm gonna put you in here. Come on.
Get in. Stay in here.  I don't wanna stay here by myself.
Stay in here no matter what. I'll be back.
I have to find April, okay? I'll be back, I promise.
Let's get something to tie her up!
I gotta call Father Gordon. We gotta get him out here.
He's too far away. She won't make it. Look at her.
Then you need to leave.  What are you talking about?
I have to do it. The exorcism.
What? I thought you said we need a priest. You're not a priest.
Well, you got a better idea?  He can do it.
You can do it.  But you gotta get out of here.
I'm not leaving you!  Damn it, I'm not doing this with you in here!
God brought us together for a reason. This is it.
"In the name of the Father, the Son, the Holy Spirit."
Hold her still! Hold her still!
Carolyn. Carolyn. Don't give in! Don't let her take you!
Ed! You gotta stop, you're killing her. Stop!
Understand this! We are now fighting for her soul!
"In the name of Jesus Christ, the saints and all the angels...
Hold her still! Don't let her up!
Damn you! You leave my family alone, you hear me?
I don't know what you are, but you leave my wife alone, goddamn it!
Let her go! Do you hear me? Let her go!
Let her go, goddamn it! Let her go!
And now you're all gonna die.
I found her! She's under the house! Under the kitchen!
Carolyn!  She's in that hole. Right there.
By the power of God, I condemn you back to hell!
Roger. We need to get her to fight from the inside.
Don't let her do this. Don't let this thing do this.
You gotta fight it. You're stronger than she is.
You gotta fight!  Keep it going, Roger!
You gotta stay with us, all right? Come on back, Carolyn.
You're in, that's it! Get her back!
Remember what you showed me.  No!
Remember that day that you said you would never forget.
You said they meant the world to you.
This is what you'll be leaving behind.
I love you so much. I love you so much.
A draft do that to your face?
I'd take a guy with a gun any day.
I'll call Father Gordon and let him know what happened.
And if we can, then he'd like to meet with us tomorrow.
There's a case in Long Island he'd like to discuss.
